meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: YOU KNOW WHAT'S COOL? $1 BILLION

div.a: Apple Beats Samsung, Awarded Over $1 Billion Damages

div.div: Apple Inc. scored a sweeping legal victory over Samsung on Friday as a U.S. jury found the Korean company had copied critical features of the hugely popular iPhone and iPad and awarded the U.S. company $1.051 billion in damages.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OdmG7G&via=Digg&text=Apple Beats Samsung, Awarded Over $1 Billion Damages

div.div: WATER BALLOON ART
"We found a bunch of awesome bald men and hurled water balloons at their heads, to capture the explosion of water at various intervals. The result a new head of of water hair!"

li.div:
Best thing on the internet today behance.net/gallery/Water-...
Wigs made of water!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NEptaW&via=Digg&text=Water Wigs For Bald Men

div.div: LOGO-JACKING

div.a: Is This How Microsoft's Team Built Its Logo?

div.div: Frankly, at this point, it would be more surprising if Microsoft did not lift its designs from Apple products. Andrew Brett Watson shows us how it is done.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P2B5TO&via=Digg&text=Is This How Microsoft's Team Built Its Logo?

div.div: FAIRY TALE ART EXHIBITS

div.a: Real-Life 'Sleeping Beauties' Are Waiting To Be Kissed

div.div: A group of real-life ‘Sleeping Beauties’ are destined to sleep forever in the National Art Museum of Ukraine, unless worthy male patrons are prepared to wake them up with a single kiss.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Nm0wWd&via=Digg&text=Real-Life 'Sleeping Beauties' Are Waiting To Be Kissed

div.div: TRAGIC

div.a: Hippo Stranded In Pool Dies As Rescue Fails

div.div: One story has dominated South African television news and it isn't politics or crime. It is the death of a stranded hippo.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RihrIu&via=Digg&text=Hippo Stranded In Pool Dies As Rescue Fails

div.div: VISUAL HISTORY

div.a: Logos Of Famous Brands, Then And Now

div.div: StockLogos.com has compiled and compared the first and current versions of logos used by some of the world’s biggest brands.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OdFiIh&via=Digg&text=Logos Of Famous Brands, Then And Now

div.div: LUCRATIVE DATA

div.a: Why Big Companies Buy, Sell Your Data

div.div: They know your name, your phone number, where you live, your buying habits and, in many cases, what you are interested in buying -- sometimes even before you do. Meet Acxiom, sometimes described as "the biggest company you've never heard of."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/No6DDi&via=Digg&text=Why Big Companies Buy, Sell Your Data

div.div: SENSITIVE ANIMALS

div.a: Scientists Argue That Animals Have Conscious Awareness

div.div: An international group of prominent scientists has signed The Cambridge Declaration on Consciousness in which they are proclaiming their support for the idea that animals are conscious and aware to the degree that humans are — a list of animals that includes all mammals, birds, and even the octopus.

li.div: science clears up what my dogs shared with me years ago: animals are conscious beings. io9.com/5937356/prominent-scie... #iloveanimals

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P5CSwY&via=Digg&text=Scientists Argue That Animals Have Conscious Awareness

div.div: CRIBS: PRISON EDITION

div.a: Norwegian Mass Murderer's Prison Cell Features Gym, Laptop

div.div: Norwegian mass killer Anders Behring Breivik is due to serve his 21-year sentence in Ila prison near the capital, Oslo. Each cell comes with a bedroom, fitness area, and a study with a laptop.

li.div: #Breivik currently has three prison cells in "compensation" for being denied access to activities. More about his jail bbc.co.uk/news/world-europ...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PfvFpO&via=Digg&text=Norwegian Mass Murderer's Prison Cell Features Gym, Laptop

div.div: ESB SHOOTING

div.a: Instagram Photo Of NYC Shooting Victim Sparks Media Frenzy

div.div: Just a few hours ago, a man opened fire at the Empire State Building in New York City, killing a former co-worker before being gunned down by police. Ryan Pitcheralle was passing through the area when the shooting occurred, and used Instagram to capture a photograph of the victim lying in a pool of blood.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U067Aw&via=Digg&text=Instagram Photo Of NYC Shooting Victim Sparks Media Frenzy

div.div: ANATOMY OF A SEARCH

div.a: What Happens When Someone Goes Missing?

div.div: Vital clues may be found in the first few hours after someone disappears. But how do police decide which cases to prioritise?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NNtGco&via=Digg&text=What Happens When Someone Goes Missing?

div.div: EXPLOSIVE PHENOMENONS
First things first - yes, it turns out that spontaneous combustion of humans might actually be a real thing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RiczTq&via=Digg&text=Spontaneous Human Combustion Is Real

div.div: EPIDEMIOLOGY MEETS LINGUISTICS

div.a: Disease Map Pinpoints Origin Of Languages

div.div: Turkey might be the geographic origin of languages from English to Hindi, according to epidemiological tracking techniques.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/StuE2o&via=Digg&text=Disease Map Pinpoints Origin Of Languages

div.div: PREQUEL TO DIEHARD

div.a: Bruce Willis Dances In 1984 Commercial For Levi's 501 Jeans

div.div: Bruce Willis dancing in the 80s. That is all.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NM7IX8&via=Digg&text=Bruce Willis Dances In 1984 Commercial For Levi's 501 Jeans

div.div: FUTURE WAR

div.a: From Bug Drones To Disease Assassins, Super Weapons Rule US War Game

div.div: A two-day war game reveals the futuristic threats that the U.S. is planning for and the weapons it will deploy against them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Odkssw&via=Digg&text=From Bug Drones To Disease Assassins, Super Weapons Rule US War Game

div.div: THAT'S ONE WAY OF PUTTING IT

div.a: Fox News Identifies Michael Jordan As 'Failed Baseball Player'

div.div: Ignore for a moment the amusing photo of President Obama pointing and instead focus your attention on the caption provided by Fox News.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OZiyYt&via=Digg&text=Fox News Identifies Michael Jordan As 'Failed Baseball Player'

div.div: GOVERNMENT

Aside from the sheer biological ludicrousness of Todd Akin’s ideas on female physiology, one unsettling subplot to the debacle is his presence on the House of Committee on Science, Space and Technology.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PD1ETV&via=Digg&text=The Anti-Science House Science Committee

div.div: CRUEL AND UNUSUAL

div.a: Recording Industry Succeeds In Ruining a Kid's Life Over 31 Stupid Songs

div.div: Yesterday marked the end of Joel Tenenbaum's court battle with the RIAA over 31 songs he illegally distributed on Kazaa. A federal judge denied his latest appeal, and now he's on the hook for $675,000.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OcMzEN&via=Digg&text=Recording Industry Succeeds In Ruining a Kid's Life Over 31 Stupid Songs

div.div: SONGS IN THE PALM OF YOUR HAND
What would your favorite album look like in three dimensions?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/O9WZVI&via=Digg&text=What Music Looks Like In 3D

div.div: BEAUTY OF THE WORLD

From shelf clouds to supercell clouds, those white and fluffy things in the sky are not always, well, white and fluffy. Some, as you will see, are just downright weird and wacky. Many are a portent of bad things to come.

li.div: Not sure me saying "This is a great montage of cloud images" sells it. But it's just stunning beautiful: guardian.co.uk/science/gal...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/O6ufyE&via=Digg&text=Unusual Clouds Caught On Camera

div.div: WHY THE INTERNET SUCKS

div.a: The Uncanny Valley Of Internet Advertising

div.div: Targeted Web ads are too dumb to be useful and just smart enough to make you queasy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OZvkq2&via=Digg&text=The Uncanny Valley Of Internet Advertising

div.div: UNDERGROUND DINING

div.a: Dining Deep In A Finnish Mine

div.div: Diners who wish to participate in what could be Europe's most surreal eating experience this year are out of luck. The "Muru Pops Down" pop-up restaurant, opening on September 10 inside a Finnish limestone mine, is totally booked.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PAkScM&via=Digg&text=Dining Deep In A Finnish Mine

div.div: INSECT JAWAS!

div.a: South American Roaches Glow In The Dark

div.div: Under normal light, this roach looks normal enough. But under a fluorescent light, its three spots—two large ones and one very tiny one just visible under the right spot—light up like a Christmas tree.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RgLNuH&via=Digg&text=South American Roaches Glow In The Dark
